title: Build a Cyberpunk Card (Advanced)
description: Build a complete cyberpunk-styled card component from scratch

steps.title: Step 1: The Challenge
steps.content:
**Your Mission**: Build a cyberpunk-styled card component that matches the design shown.

**Requirements**:
- Dark background (#0a0a0a)
- Cyan accent color (#00ffff)
- Glowing border effect
- Flexbox for layout
- Hover effects

You'll write all the CSS yourself. Use the preview to check your work!
steps.visual:
DIVINE NODE

A self-hosted AI system with multi-agent architecture and cyberpunk aesthetic.

task.instruction: Build the card shown above. Start with the HTML structure provided.
task.htmlStarter:
DIVINE NODE

A self-hosted AI system with multi-agent architecture and cyberpunk aesthetic.
requirements: card-btn should have cyan gradient background
Use padding and border-radius for spacing and rounded corners
hints: box-shadow: 0 0 20px rgba(0,255,255,0.5) creates a glow effect
Use flexbox or appropriate spacing with margin/padding

steps.title: Step 2: Add Hover Effects
steps.content:
Make your card interactive! Add hover effects that:
- Increase the glow when hovering over the card
- Make the button brighter on hover
- Add a smooth transition

**Hint**: Use `:hover` pseudo-class and `transition` property.
steps.visual:
DIVINE NODE

Hover state with enhanced glow!

task.instruction: Add hover effects to your card and button:
hints: transform: scale(1.05) makes button slightly bigger
transition: all 0.3s ease applies to all properties
Add transition to the base class, not the :hover

steps.title: Step 3: Responsive Design
steps.content:
Make your card responsive! It should:
- Stack vertically on mobile (max-width: 768px)
- Adjust padding for smaller screens
- Scale font sizes appropriately

**Use media queries** to handle different screen sizes.

task.instruction: Add responsive design with media queries:
requirements: Adjust card max-width to be responsive
hints: max-width: 100% makes card fill container on mobile
padding: 20px is more comfortable on small screens
font-size: 0.9em or similar for card-text on mobile
You can adjust button padding too

steps.title: Step 4: Final Polish
steps.content:
Add final touches to make your card production-ready:
- Font families (use system fonts or monospace)
- Letter spacing for the title
- Text shadow for extra depth
- Smooth animations

Make it **your own** - experiment and iterate!

hints: font-family: 'Courier New', monospace for cyber look
